transcription.transcription: This is one of the most dangerous jobs in the world. Every day, the work environment is high-voltage power lines hundreds of meters above the ground. These electricians not only have to climb with almost no safety protection, but also navigate complex terrain, constantly facing the risk of falling. To save time, they have to eat and even rest while suspended in the air. Sometimes, they must maintain their balance in unstable positions. This is not only a test of physical fitness, but also a psychological challenge. In summer, they endure the scorching heat of the sun, While in winter, the danger doubles as the icy power lines become slippery, requiring extreme caution with every step. Moreover, the temperature difference between day and night at such heights is huge, making it easy to lose balance. More importantly, the thousands of volts of electricity themselves pose a tremendous danger. One small mistake can cause burns or even death. High-voltage electricity also produces arc discharge, which can strike even without direct contact. Therefore, despite the high salary, many people give up this job. If it were you,

video_info.title: Shortest war in history! ┃ Geography Facts! #facts #geography #history #funfacts #world #subscribe
video_info.description:
Shortest war in history! ┃ Geography Facts! #facts #geography #history #funfacts #world #subscribe 

In this video i show you the shortest lasting war ever! Like and subscribe for more content!

transcription.transcription: This was the shortest war in human history. It started at 9.02 a.m., and by 9.40, it was over. The Anglo-Zanzibar War lasted just 38 minutes. Yes, minutes. So what happened? In 1896, a new sultan took power in Zanzibar. But the British didn't like him. They gave him an ultimatum, step down, or face war. He said no. The British bombarded his palace, sank his yacht, and destroyed his artillery, all within half an hour. He surrendered, and the British took control over Zanzibar.

video_info.title: the luckiest person ever
video_info.description:
in this video, i talk about the luckiest person ever
if you liked the video, don't forget to subscribe

transcription.transcription: Who is the luckiest person ever? You might think it'd be someone like Vesna Vulović, a flight attendant who was working on a plane that exploded midair. After falling over 30,000 feet, she actually survived and made a full recovery. However, surprisingly, she doesn't even come close to the luckiest person ever. Not even Julianne Kepke comes close, a 17-year-old who was the only survivor of a plane crash over the Amazon. After falling over 10,000 feet, she survived for 11 days in the jungle, before being rescued. You see, the luckiest person to ever live has to be Mark Thompson. In 1985, Mark was piloting a small plane when the engine stopped working. Crazily, he survived the crash without a scratch. Then, a couple years later, he decided to go skydiving. During the jump, both his main and reserve parachutes didn't work, but he somehow landed in a marsh and was mostly okay. Finally, a few months later, he was out hiking when he was caught in an avalanche. His friends were able to dig him out and once again, he was fine.

a flight attendant who was working on a plane that exploded midair.

transcription.transcription: What if the Earth was actually flat? As you probably know, the Earth is round. But for thousands of years, people believed it was flat. A giant disc with edges you could fall off. So, what if they were right? For starters, the continents would stretch across a flat plane. And Antarctica would be a towering ice wall wrapped around the edges, holding the oceans in like a frozen rim. But the laws of nature would break almost immediately. Gravity wouldn't pull straight down anymore. The farther you move from the center, the more sideways it pours, triggering massive tsunamis in the oceans, collapsing mountains, and thinning the air near the edges. Even the sky above would change as the sun wouldn't rise and set. It would circle above like a spotlight, lighting some places more than others. This would confuse seasonal cycles and throw time zones into chaos. And forget flying planes. You see, planes rely on GPS. And GPS only works because satellites stay in orbit. Without Earth's constant gravitational pull, these satellites would just drift into space.

segments.text: What if the Earth was actually flat?
As you probably know, the Earth is round.
But for thousands of years, people believed it was flat.
A giant disc with edges you could fall off.
So, what if they were right?
For starters, the continents would stretch across a flat plane.
And Antarctica would be a towering ice wall wrapped around the edges,
holding the oceans in like a frozen rim.
But the laws of nature would break almost immediately.
Gravity wouldn't pull straight down anymore.
The farther you move from the center, the more sideways it pours,
triggering massive tsunamis in the oceans, collapsing mountains, and thinning the air near the edges.
Even the sky above would change as the sun wouldn't rise and set.
It would circle above like a spotlight, lighting some places more than others.
This would confuse seasonal cycles and throw time zones into chaos.
And forget flying planes.
You see, planes rely on GPS.
And GPS only works because satellites stay in orbit.
Without Earth's constant gravitational pull, these satellites would just drift into space.

transcription.transcription: What would happen if the world's original supercontinent came back? This is Pangea, a single giant landmass that existed hundreds of millions of years ago, before splitting into the continents we know today. Now imagine it coming back. Asia, Africa, Europe, the Americas, all crashing back together into one giant piece of land. If that happened, sea levels would plummet, and hidden places like Zealandia, the sunken continent beneath New Zealand, could rise back above water, creating a new landmass almost the size of Australia. But geography wouldn't be the only thing to change. Peaceful oceans that once separated rival nations would be gone. The U.S. might suddenly share land borders with Morocco. Australia could merge with Southeast Asia. And Canada could touch parts of Portugal and Spain. New neighbors could mean new disputes over land, resources, and borders that no one ever agreed on. trade routes would collapse, and global shipping would have to reinvent itself. So it wouldn't just be a new map, it would be a new world.

video_info.title: Why No Bridge Here? 🌉 New Zealand’s Main Islands 🇳🇿

transcription.transcription: Why isn't there a bridge between New Zealand's North and South Islands? The two are only 22 kilometers apart, close enough that you can see one coast from the other. This distance doesn't seem like much when compared to the world's longest bridge in China, which stretches 165 kilometers. So why isn't there a connection between the two? The thing is, the Cook Strait is nearly 130 meters deep, and the ocean currents here are among the strongest on Earth, shifting direction every few hours, making construction difficult. Also, drilling a tunnel is nearly impossible as the seabed is made up of hard rock. But the biggest reason of all is that the region lies on the Ring of Fire, a major seismic zone where frequent earthquakes pose a serious risk to any structure. So, all these factors make the construction of a bridge or tunnel here nearly impossible.

video_info.title: Why Half of Australia Is Empty 🤯
tags: why half of australia is empty
why north of australia is empty

transcription.transcription: See this side of Australia? It's almost empty, with no major cities. While this side, it's packed with cities like Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, and Adelaide. Even though the North is closer to Asia's shipping lanes than anywhere else in the country. In fact, fewer than 600,000 people live in the North, while over 27 million live in the South. And there's a very interesting reason behind this strange population gap. When the British arrived in 1788, they weren't building a country, they were building a prison. Australia's first colony wasn't meant to thrive or trade. It was meant to isolate. A penal colony far from everyone and everything. So they picked the south, where the harbors were calmer, the weather cooler, and escape was harder. Australia didn't grow from its most connected point. It grew from its most forgotten.

segments.text: See this side of Australia? It's almost empty, with no major cities.

So they picked the south,
where the harbors were calmer, the weather cooler,
and escape was harder.
Australia didn't grow from its most connected point.
It grew from its most forgotten.

video_info.title: This Country Could Soon Disappear Forever 😢🌊
video_info.description:
Did you know there’s a country that might completely vanish underwater within your lifetime?

Most of its land sits just 2 meters above sea level, and with the oceans rising, every storm swallows a little more of its future. Saltwater floods the fields. Homes are abandoned. And crops can’t grow.

In response, the country took a drastic step: it signed a historic deal with Australia, known as the Falepili Act, allowing up to 280 of its citizens to relocate as climate refugees each year.

But here’s the wildest part—this country is now building a digital version of itself. A full online replica of its land and culture in the metaverse. So it can live on, even if it sinks beneath the sea.

It’ll be the first nation to exist only in the cloud. And if you haven’t guessed the country. It’s Tuvalu.

#geography #map #countries

video_info.title: This Town Changed Countries 8 Times in 30 Days 🤯

transcription.transcription: Did you know there's a town in Europe that changed countries not once, not twice, but eight times? And that too in just one single month? This happened in 1944. The town was located in Alsace-Lorraine, a region situated on the border between France and Germany, a place both nations had fought over for generations. As Allied forces pushed in and German troops fought back, the town switched hands back and forth, again and again. One day you were French, the next German. then French again, then German again. You get the idea. The signs changed, the currency changed, even the laws and language in schools kept changing, sometimes overnight. For the locals, it was more than confusing. It was terrifying. They didn't know which flag to have on their doorstep or whom to trust. And if you haven't guessed the name of the town, it's Apash.

video_info.title: Why This Desert Is Unlike Any Other 🏜️🤯
video_info.description:
Did you know there’s a desert on our planet that’s so dry… even a light rainfall can make it bloom like a rainforest?

It sounds impossible, but this place actually exists—and it's among the driest regions on Earth.

Some areas of this desert haven't seen rain in over 500 years. NASA even tests Mars rovers here due to its extreme conditions.

But in rare years, climate shifts like El Niño bring sudden downpours to the region—turning barren ground into a vibrant carpet of pink and purple flowers.

A phenomenon locals call ‘desierto florido’, meaning "blooming desert."

But, where is this extraordinary place?

It's located in northern Chile, and it's the Atacama Desert.

NASA even tests Mars rovers here due to its extreme conditions. But in rare years, climate shifts like El Nino bring sudden downpours to the region, turning barren ground into a vibrant carpet of pink and purple flowers, a phenomenon locals call Desierto Florido, meaning blooming desert. But where is this extraordinary place? It's located in northern Chile, and it's the Atacama Desert.

video_info.title: Why This River Reverses Every 6 Months 🔄🌧️
video_info.description:
Did you know there’s a river on Earth that flows backwards every six months?

Sounds impossible, right? But it’s true. And this natural phenomenon happens in Southeast Asia.

Meet the Tonlé Sap River, located in Cambodia.

For half the year, it flows south into the mighty Mekong River.

But when the monsoon rains arrive, the Mekong River expands more than five times its usual size, pushing the river water back, and forcing the Tonlé Sap to go the other direction and flow north—filling up a massive freshwater lake.

And this natural reversal isn’t just a strange anomaly. It’s vital for life in the region, as the expanding lake creates one of the richest inland fishing grounds in the world, feeding millions of people.

So while all the other rivers only flow in one direction, the Tonlé Sap listens to the sky… And when the rain tells it to turn around—it does.

video_info.title: What If a New Continent Appeared in the Pacific? 🌍
video_info.description:
What if a new continent suddenly appeared in the Pacific Ocean?

Well, the Pacific is the largest ocean on Earth—so massive, it could literally fit all the continents inside it and still have room for one more continent. And if a new landmass appeared here, the entire world map would change.

New borders would need to be drawn. Trade routes would shift. But the biggest question—who would claim this land?

The United States would likely move first due to its close proximity to Hawaii. China would also send its ships to build artificial islands, just like it did in the South China Sea. Then there’s Australia and New Zealand, who might see this as a once-in-a-lifetime chance to rise on the global stage.

But why would everyone want it?

Well, a new land could be rich in resources like oil, rare metals, and gold, making it one of the most valuable places on Earth. And with its location in the middle of the Pacific, it could become a global hub for trade, naval power, and influence.

video_info.title: Why No Bridge on the Amazon River? 🌉🌊

transcription.transcription: Did you know why there isn't a single bridge across the Amazon River? You see, the Amazon is one of the longest rivers in the world, stretching over 7,000 kilometers from east to west. That's almost as long as the Nile, which, by the way, has over 100 bridges crossing it. So why hasn't anyone built even one bridge here? Well, the main reason isn't just geography, but what lies under the ground. Scientists recently discovered a second river deep below the Amazon called the Hamza River. This hidden underground river makes the ground above it soft and unstable, making large-scale construction nearly impossible. Also, during the rainy season, the Amazon can get really wide. It can expand from just one or two kilometers to almost 50 kilometers across, turning it into the most unpredictable river in the world.

informalization.formatted_prompt:
You are a professional script writer specializing in video script rephrasing. Your task is to rephrase the following video script to a desired tone.

**rephrasing Guidelines:**
- Maintain the original meaning of each segment
- Keep rephrased segments approximately the same length as the original (±10-20% word count)
- Preserve natural speech patterns and conversational flow for Persian
- Keep the timing and pacing suitable for video synchronization

**Input Format:**
The orignal script is divided into segments, where each segment typically represents one sentence or natural speech unit.

**Required Output Format:**
Return your script as a valid JSON object.

script to rephrase:
<segments>
<segment>این کوتاه‌ترین جنگ در تاریخ بشر بود. در ساعت ۹:۰۲ صبح شروع شد و تا ساعت ۹:۴۰ تمام شد.</segment>
<segment>جنگ انگلیس و زنگبار تنها ۳۸ دقیقه طول کشید. بله، دقیقه. پس چه اتفاقی افتاد؟ در سال ۱۸۹۶، یک</segment>
<segment>سلطان جدید در زنگبار به قدرت رسید. اما بریتانیایی‌ها او را دوست نداشتند. به او اولتیماتوم دادند،</segment>
<segment>که کناره‌گیری کند، وگرنه با جنگ روبرو خواهد شد. او گفت نه. بریتانیایی‌ها کاخ او را بمباران کردند، قایق تفریحی‌اش را غرق کردند،</segment>
<segment>و توپخانه‌اش را نابود کردند، همه این‌ها در عرض نیم ساعت.</segment>
<segment>او تسلیم شد، و بریتانیایی‌ها کنترل زنگبار را در دست گرفتند.</segment>
</segments>
Language: Persian
target tone: informal, friendly, and engaging
Please provide the complete script maintaining segment indexing and approximate length parity.

segments.original: می‌دونستید کوتاه‌ترین جنگ تاریخ بشر چقدر طول کشید؟ از ۹:۰۲ صبح شروع شد و تا ۹:۴۰ تموم شد!
segments.transformed: می‌دونِستید کوتاه‌تَرین جَنگِ تاریخِ بَشَر چِقَدر طول کِشید؟ اَز ۹:۰۲ صُبح شُروع شُد و تا ۹:۴۰ تَموم شُد!

segments.original: جنگ انگلیس و زنگبار فقط ۳۸ دقیقه! بله، دقیقه! حالا چی شد که این‌قدر زود تموم شد؟ ماجرا از سال ۱۸۹۶ شروع می‌شه...
segments.transformed: جَنگِ اَنگلیس و زَنگبار فَقَط ۳۸ دَقیقِه! بَلِه، دَقیقِه! حالا چی شُد کِه این‌قَدر زود تَموم شُد؟ ماجَرا اَز سالِ ۱۸۹۶ شُروع می‌شِه...

segments.original: سلطان جدیدی اومد سر کار. اما خب، انگلیسی‌ها ازش خوششون نیومد. واسه همین بهش یه اتمام حجت دادن,
segments.transformed: سُلطانِ جَدیدی اومَد سَرِ کار. اَمّا خُب، اَنگلیسی‌ها اَزَش خُوشِشون نَیومَد. واسِه هَمین بِهِش یِه اِتمامِ حُجَّت دادَن،

segments.original: که یا باید استعفا بده، یا آماده جنگ باشه. ولی اون قبول نکرد و گفت نه! انگلیسی‌ها هم چی کار کردن؟ کاخش رو بمبارون کردن، کشتی تفریحی‌ش رو غرق کردن,
segments.transformed: کِه یا بایَد اِستِعفا بِدِه، یا آمادِه جَنگ باشِه. وَلی اون قَبول نَکَرد و گُفت نَه! اَنگلیسی‌ها هَم چی کار کَردَن؟ کاخَش رو بُمبارون کَردَن، کِشتیِ تَفریحی‌ِش رو غَرق کَردَن،

segments.original: و توپخونه‌ش رو هم نابود کردن. تازه، همه این اتفاقا فقط تو نیم ساعت افتاد!
segments.transformed: وَ توپخونِه-ش رو هَم نابود کَردَن. تازِه، هَمِه این اِتِّفاقا فَقَط تو نیم ساعَت اُفتاد!

segments.original: خلاصه که اون تسلیم شد، و انگلیسی‌ها هم زنگبار رو گرفتن دست خودشون.
segments.transformed: خُلاصِه کِه اون تَسلیم شُد، وَ اَنگلیسی‌ها هَم زَنگبار رو گِرِفتَن دَستِ خُودِشون.

vocalization.formatted_prompt:
Persona: You are an expert in Persian linguistics and orthography. Your specialization is in preparing written Persian text for high-fidelity Text-to-Speech (TTS) synthesis. You have a deep understanding of Persian phonetics, grammar, and the correct application of diacritics (اعراب).

Objective: Your primary task is to process a given raw Persian text script and make it "TTS-ready." This involves two main actions:

Vocalization (اعراب‌گذاری): Add all necessary Persian diacritics to every word to remove any pronunciation ambiguity.
Punctuation (علامت‌گذاری): Add or correct punctuation to guide the TTS engine in creating natural pauses, rhythm, and intonation.
Core Instructions:

Add Diacritics: You must meticulously add the correct diacritics to the text. This includes, but is not limited to:

Fatḥa (ـَ / زَبَر)
Kasra (ـِ / زیر)
Ḍamma (ـُ / پیش)
Sukūn (ـْ / سکون)
Tashdīd (ـّ / تشدید)
Tanvīn (ـً, ـٍ, ـٌ)
Add Punctuation: Analyze the grammatical structure and meaning of the sentences to insert appropriate punctuation. This includes:

Period / Full Stop (.) at the end of declarative sentences.
Comma (، or ,) for separating clauses, items in a list, or for natural pauses.
Question Mark (؟ or ?) at the end of questions.
Exclamation Mark (!) for exclamatory sentences.
Colon (:) and Semicolon (؛) where grammatically appropriate.
Crucial Constraints:

Do NOT alter the text: You must not change any words, their order, or the meaning of the original script.
Preserve Integrity: The original text must remain 100% intact. Your only job is to add diacritics and punctuation, not to edit or rephrase.
Completeness: Every single word that requires diacritics for unambiguous pronunciation must be vocalized. Do not leave common words un-vocalized.
Example:

Input Text: من به مدرسه میروم تا درس بخوانم

Expected Output: مَن به مَدرِسِه می‌رَوَم تا دَرس بِخوانَم.

Input Text: سلام چطوری خوبی

Expected Output: سَلام، چِطوری؟ خوبی؟



**Input Format:**
The orignal script is divided into segments, where each segment typically represents one sentence or natural speech unit.

**Required Output Format:**
Return your script as a valid JSON object. Your final output should be ONLY the fully vocalized and punctuated Persian text. 

script to vocalize:
<segments>
<segment>می‌دونستید کوتاه‌ترین جنگ تاریخ بشر چقدر طول کشید؟ از ۹:۰۲ صبح شروع شد و تا ۹:۴۰ تموم شد!</segment>
<segment>جنگ انگلیس و زنگبار فقط ۳۸ دقیقه! بله، دقیقه! حالا چی شد که این‌قدر زود تموم شد؟ ماجرا از سال ۱۸۹۶ شروع می‌شه...</segment>
<segment>سلطان جدیدی اومد سر کار. اما خب، انگلیسی‌ها ازش خوششون نیومد. واسه همین بهش یه اتمام حجت دادن،</segment>
<segment>که یا باید استعفا بده، یا آماده جنگ باشه. ولی اون قبول نکرد و گفت نه! انگلیسی‌ها هم چی کار کردن؟ کاخش رو بمبارون کردن، کشتی تفریحی‌ش رو غرق کردن،</segment>
<segment>و توپخونه‌ش رو هم نابود کردن. تازه، همه این اتفاقا فقط تو نیم ساعت افتاد!</segment>
<segment>خلاصه که اون تسلیم شد، و انگلیسی‌ها هم زنگبار رو گرفتن دست خودشون.</segment>
</segments>
Please provide the complete script maintaining segment indexing and approximate length parity.

thumbnail.formatted_prompt:
generate an image of a high-impact, cinematic YouTube thumbnail 9:16 aspect ratio

1. Background Image:
Generate a highly detailed and atmospheric background based on the video's core theme of: Shortest war in history! ┃ Geography Facts! #facts #geography #history #funfacts #world #subscribe 

In this video i show you the shortest lasting war ever! Like and subscribe for more content!

Scene Type: The scene is a [e.g., Satellite map of a continent, Sci-fi cityscape, Ancient battlefield, Volcanic landscape, Abstract network of data].

Visual Style: Render the scene in a specific, high-fidelity style Cinematic digital painting

Perspective & Framing: Use a dynamic, slight oblique angle or a three-quarters perspective to create a sense of depth and scale. Frame the shot to feel grand and expansive. Avoid flat, top-down, or straight-on views.

Color & Lighting: Employ a rich, saturated color palette with high contrast. The lighting should be dramatic and moody, for example: [e.g., The low light of dusk with long shadows, An ominous overcast sky, Glowing neon city lights, The harsh glare of a sun over a desert].

Detail Level: The background must be sharp and filled with intricate details and textures, making the environment feel tangible and immersive, not blurry or abstract.

2. Dramatic Overlay:
Overlay high-resolution, realistic visual effects (VFX) like smoke, fire, or energy glows onto the background. These effects should be strategically placed to add drama and relate to the core subject of: Shortest war in history! ┃ Geography Facts! #facts #geography #history #funfacts #world #subscribe.


The final image must feel dramatic and urgent, undeniable focus.

variations.video_title: کوتاهترین جنگ تاریخ جهان! باورنکردنی ترین حقایق جنگی!
variations.video_description: کوتاهترین جنگ تاریخ جهان را بشناسید! در این ویدئو به بررسی نبرد باورنکردنی‌ای می‌پردازیم که تنها چند دقیقه طول کشید. این واقعه شگفت‌انگیز نمونه‌ای از حقایق جالب و عجیب جغرافیا و تاریخ است. برای دانستنی‌های بیشتر، سابسکرایب کنید و لایک یادتون نره! #کوتاهترین_جنگ #تاریخ #حقایق_جهان #جنگ_جهانی #دانستنیها

variations.video_title: رکورد کوتاهترین جنگ دنیا! حقایق جغرافیایی شگفت‌انگیز
variations.video_description: کشف کنید: کوتاهترین جنگ تاریخ دنیا! در این ویدئو، عمیقاً به حقایق جغرافیایی و تاریخی نبرد فراموش‌نشدنی می‌پردازیم که بسیار سریع به پایان رسید. این تنها یکی از دانستنی‌های جالب دنیای ماست. با ما همراه باشید و برای محتوای بیشتر کانال را سابسکرایب کنید. #کوتاهترین_جنگ #جغرافیا #حقایق_تاریخی #دانستنی_جالب #عجیب

variations.video_title: سریعترین جنگ تاریخ! هرگز باور نخواهید کرد چقدر کوتاه بود!
variations.video_description: سریعترین جنگ تاریخ بشر را بشناسید! این ویدئو به بررسی جزئیات این نبرد باورنکردنی می‌پردازد که در کمتر از یک ساعت به پایان رسید. حقایق جالب و شگفت‌انگیز تاریخ و جغرافیا در انتظار شماست. ویدئو را لایک کنید و برای تماشای ویدئوهای بعدی سابسکرایب کنید. #جنگ_کوتاه #تاریخ_جهان #حقایق_عجیب #دانستنیهای_تاریخی #دانش

variations.video_title: رکورد تاریخی کوتاهترین جنگ دنیا! حقایقی که باید بدانید!
variations.video_description: رکورددار کوتاهترین جنگ تاریخ جهان را بشناسید! در این ویدئو حقایق شگفت‌انگیز و کمتر شنیده‌شده‌ای درباره این نبرد سریع و عواقب آن ارائه می‌دهیم. این اطلاعات برای علاقه‌مندان به تاریخ و جغرافیا ضروری است. اگر به دانستنی‌های عجیب علاقه دارید، حتماً لایک و سابسکرایب کنید! #کوتاهترین_جنگ #رکورد_جهان #دانستنیها #تاریخ_جنگ #جغرافیا_تاریخ

metadata.formatted_prompt:
You are an expert YouTube SEO and localization specialist. Your task is to translate and optimize video metadata for a new international audience. You will be given a target language, an original video title, and an original video description.

Your goal is to create compelling, natural-sounding, and highly searchable titles and descriptions in the specified target language. You must also generate relevant hashtags in description text.

Generate 4 YouTube video titles and descriptions with hashtags in the target language. Apply YouTube SEO best practices to maximize discoverability and engagement.

INPUTS:
- Target Language: fa
- Original Video Title: Shortest war in history! ┃ Geography Facts! #facts #geography #history #funfacts #world #subscribe
- Original Video Description: Shortest war in history! ┃ Geography Facts! #facts #geography #history #funfacts #world #subscribe 

In this video i show you the shortest lasting war ever! Like and subscribe for more content!

YOUTUBE SEO BEST PRACTICES TO APPLY:
1. Include primary keywords in the first 125 characters of descriptions
2. Use 3-5 relevant hashtags (mix of broad and specific)
3. Create compelling titles between 60-70 characters
4. Include a clear call-to-action (subscribe, like, comment)
5. Add relevant keywords naturally throughout the description
6. Use power words and emotional triggers in titles
7. Include numbers or lists when applicable
8. Front-load important information in descriptions

REQUIREMENTS:
- ouput is JSON
- Generate 4 different variations
- Each variation should have a unique angle or focus
- Maintain the core message of the original content
- Adapt cultural references and idioms appropriately
- Use native expressions that resonate with the target language audience


Ensure all content is culturally appropriate and uses natural language patterns for the target audience. Prioritize clarity, engagement, and search visibility.
